p: In vivo, the acute oral toxicity of an ethanol root extract (EEC) of E. chinense and its chloroform fraction (CEC) was evaluated in female rats following the OECD (Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development) guideline 425. Administration of EEC and its subfractions did not cause any signs of toxicity or mortality up to 2Â g/kg during the observation period of 14 days ( Prasad et al., 2013b).
